<a id="class_TreeItem"></a>

# TreeItem

**Inherits:** [Object](class_object.md)

An internal control for a single item inside [Tree](class_tree.md).

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

A single item of a [Tree](class_tree.md) control. It can contain other **TreeItem**\ s as children, which allows it to create a hierarchy. It can also contain text and buttons. **TreeItem** is not a [Node](class_node.md), it is internal to the [Tree](class_tree.md).

To create a **TreeItem**, use [Tree.create_item()](class_tree.md#class_Tree_method_create_item) or [create_child()](class_treeitem.md#class_TreeItem_method_create_child). To remove a **TreeItem**, use [Object.free()](class_object.md#class_Object_method_free).

\ **Note:** The ID values used for buttons are 32-bit, unlike [int](class_int.md) which is always 64-bit. They go from ``-2147483648`` to ``2147483647``.

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Enumerations

<a id="enum_TreeItem_TreeCellMode"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration -->

enum **TreeCellMode**: [ðŸ”—](#enum_TreeItem_TreeCellMode)

<a id="class_TreeItem_constant_CELL_MODE_STRING"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[TreeCellMode](class_treeitem.md#enum_TreeItem_TreeCellMode) **CELL_MODE_STRING** = `0`

Cell shows a string label, optionally with an icon. When editable, the text can be edited using a [LineEdit](class_lineedit.md), or a [TextEdit](class_textedit.md) popup if [set_edit_multiline()](class_treeitem.md#class_TreeItem_method_set_edit_multiline) is used.<a id="class_TreeItem_constant_CELL_MODE_CHECK"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[TreeCellMode](class_treeitem.md#enum_TreeItem_TreeCellMode) **CELL_MODE_CHECK** = `1`

Cell shows a checkbox, optionally with text and an icon. The checkbox can be pressed, released, or indeterminate (via [set_indeterminate()](class_treeitem.md#class_TreeItem_method_set_indeterminate)). The checkbox can't be clicked unless the cell is editable.<a id="class_TreeItem_constant_CELL_MODE_RANGE"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[TreeCellMode](class_treeitem.md#enum_TreeItem_TreeCellMode) **CELL_MODE_RANGE** = `2`

Cell shows a numeric range. When editable, it can be edited using a range slider. Use [set_range()](class_treeitem.md#class_TreeItem_method_set_range) to set the value and [set_range_config()](class_treeitem.md#class_TreeItem_method_set_range_config) to configure the range.

This cell can also be used in a text dropdown mode when you assign a text with [set_text()](class_treeitem.md#class_TreeItem_method_set_text). Separate options with a comma, e.g. ``"Option1,Option2,Option3"``.<a id="class_TreeItem_constant_CELL_MODE_ICON"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[TreeCellMode](class_treeitem.md#enum_TreeItem_TreeCellMode) **CELL_MODE_ICON** = `3`

Cell shows an icon. It can't be edited nor display text. The icon is always centered within the cell.<a id="class_TreeItem_constant_CELL_MODE_CUSTOM"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[TreeCellMode](class_treeitem.md#enum_TreeItem_TreeCellMode) **CELL_MODE_CUSTOM** = `4`

Cell shows as a clickable button. It will display an arrow similar to [OptionButton](class_optionbutton.md), but doesn't feature a dropdown (for that you can use [CELL_MODE_RANGE](class_treeitem.md#class_TreeItem_constant_CELL_MODE_RANGE)). Clicking the button emits the [Tree.item_edited](class_tree.md#class_Tree_signal_item_edited) signal. The button is flat by default, you can use [set_custom_as_button()](class_treeitem.md#class_TreeItem_method_set_custom_as_button) to display it with a [StyleBox](class_stylebox.md).

This mode also supports custom drawing using [set_custom_draw_callback()](class_treeitem.md#class_TreeItem_method_set_custom_draw_callback).<hr class="classref-section-separator">

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Property Descriptions

<a id="class_TreeItem_property_collapsed"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](class_bool.md) **collapsed** [ðŸ”—](#class_TreeItem_property_collapsed)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_collapsed**\ (\ value\: [bool](class_bool.md)\ )
- [bool](class_bool.md) **is_collapsed**\ (\ )

If ``true``, the TreeItem is collapsed.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_TreeItem_property_custom_minimum_height"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[int](class_int.md) **custom_minimum_height** [ðŸ”—](#class_TreeItem_property_custom_minimum_height)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_custom_minimum_height**\ (\ value\: [int](class_int.md)\ )
- [int](class_int.md) **get_custom_minimum_height**\ (\ )

The custom minimum height.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_TreeItem_property_disable_folding"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](class_bool.md) **disable_folding** [ðŸ”—](#class_TreeItem_property_disable_folding)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_disable_folding**\ (\ value\: [bool](class_bool.md)\ )
- [bool](class_bool.md) **is_folding_disabled**\ (\ )

If ``true``, folding is disabled for this TreeItem.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_TreeItem_property_visible"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](class_bool.md) **visible** [ðŸ”—](#class_TreeItem_property_visible)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_visible**\ (\ value\: [bool](class_bool.md)\ )
- [bool](class_bool.md) **is_visible**\ (\ )

If ``true``, the **TreeItem** is visible (default).

Note that if a **TreeItem** is set to not be visible, none of its children will be visible either.

<hr class="classref-section-separator">

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Method Descriptions

<a id="class_TreeItem_method_add_button"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **add_button**\ (\ column\: [int](class_int.md), button\: [Texture2D](class_texture2d.md), id\: [int](class_int.md) = -1, disabled\: [bool](class_bool.md) = false, tooltip_text\: [String](class_string.md) = "", description\: [String](class_string.md) = ""\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_TreeItem_method_add_button)

Adds a button with [Texture2D](class_texture2d.md) `button` to the end of the cell at column `column`. The `id` is used to identify the button in the according [Tree.button_clicked](class_tree.md#class_Tree_signal_button_clicked) signal and can be different from the buttons index. If not specified, the next available index is used, which may be retrieved by calling [get_button_count()](class_treeitem.md#class_TreeItem_method_get_button_count) immediately before this method. Optionally, the button can be `disabled` and have a `tooltip_text`. `description` is used as the button description for assistive apps.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_TreeItem_method_add_child"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **add_child**\ (\ child\: [TreeItem](class_treeitem.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_TreeItem_method_add_child)

Adds a previously unparented **TreeItem** as a direct child of this one. The `child` item must not be a part of any [Tree](class_tree.md) or parented to any **TreeItem**. See also [remove_child()](class_treeitem.md#class_TreeItem_method_remove_child).

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_TreeItem_method_call_recursive"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **call_recursive**\ (\ method\: [StringName](class_stringname.md), ...\ ) <span class="vararg">vararg</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_TreeItem_method_call_recursive)

Calls the `method` on the actual TreeItem and its children recursively. Pass parameters as a comma separated list.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_TreeItem_method_clear_buttons"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **clear_buttons**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_TreeItem_method_clear_buttons)

Removes all buttons from all columns of this item.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_TreeItem_method_clear_custom_bg_color"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **clear_custom_bg_color**\ (\ column\: [int](class_int.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_TreeItem_method_clear_custom_bg_color)

Resets the background color for the given column to default.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_TreeItem_method_clear_custom_color"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **clear_custom_color**\ (\ column\: [int](class_int.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_TreeItem_method_clear_custom_color)

Resets the color for the given column to default.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_TreeItem_method_create_child"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[TreeItem](class_treeitem.md) **create_child**\ (\ index\: [int](class_int.md) = -1\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_TreeItem_method_create_child)

Creates an item and adds it as a child.

The new item will be inserted as position `index` (the default value ``-1`` means the last position), or it will be the last child if `index` is higher than the child count.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<!-- classref-method -->

Removes the button at index `button_index` in column `column`.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_TreeItem_method_get_auto_translate_mode"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

<!-- classref-method -->

<a id="class_TreeItem_method_get_child"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[TreeItem](class_treeitem.md) **get_child**\ (\ index\: [int](class_int.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_TreeItem_method_get_child)

Returns a child item by its `index` (see [get_child_count()](class_treeitem.md#class_TreeItem_method_get_child_count)). This method is often used for iterating all children of an item.

Negative indices access the children from the last one.

<!-- classref-method -->

[TreeItem](class_treeitem.md) **get_next**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_TreeItem_method_get_next)

Returns the next sibling TreeItem in the tree or a ``null`` object if there is none.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_TreeItem_method_get_next_in_tree"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[TreeItem](class_treeitem.md) **get_next_in_tree**\ (\ wrap\: [bool](class_bool.md) = false\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_TreeItem_method_get_next_in_tree)

Returns the next TreeItem in the tree (in the context of a depth-first search) or a ``null`` object if there is none.

If `wrap` is enabled, the method will wrap around to the first element in the tree when called on the last element, otherwise it returns ``null``.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_TreeItem_method_get_next_visible"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[TreeItem](class_treeitem.md) **get_next_visible**\ (\ wrap\: [bool](class_bool.md) = false\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_TreeItem_method_get_next_visible)

Returns the next visible TreeItem in the tree (in the context of a depth-first search) or a ``null`` object if there is none.

If `wrap` is enabled, the method will wrap around to the first visible element in the tree when called on the last visible element, otherwise it returns ``null``.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_TreeItem_method_get_parent"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[TreeItem](class_treeitem.md) **get_parent**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_TreeItem_method_get_parent)

Returns the parent TreeItem or a ``null`` object if there is none.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_TreeItem_method_get_prev"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[TreeItem](class_treeitem.md) **get_prev**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_TreeItem_method_get_prev)

Returns the previous sibling TreeItem in the tree or a ``null`` object if there is none.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_TreeItem_method_get_prev_in_tree"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[TreeItem](class_treeitem.md) **get_prev_in_tree**\ (\ wrap\: [bool](class_bool.md) = false\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_TreeItem_method_get_prev_in_tree)

Returns the previous TreeItem in the tree (in the context of a depth-first search) or a ``null`` object if there is none.

If `wrap` is enabled, the method will wrap around to the last element in the tree when called on the first visible element, otherwise it returns ``null``.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_TreeItem_method_get_prev_visible"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[TreeItem](class_treeitem.md) **get_prev_visible**\ (\ wrap\: [bool](class_bool.md) = false\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_TreeItem_method_get_prev_visible)

Returns the previous visible sibling TreeItem in the tree (in the context of a depth-first search) or a ``null`` object if there is none.

If `wrap` is enabled, the method will wrap around to the last visible element in the tree when called on the first visible element, otherwise it returns ``null``.

<a id="class_TreeItem_method_move_after"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **move_after**\ (\ item\: [TreeItem](class_treeitem.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_TreeItem_method_move_after)

Moves this TreeItem right after the given `item`.

\ **Note:** You can't move to the root or move the root.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_TreeItem_method_move_before"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **move_before**\ (\ item\: [TreeItem](class_treeitem.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_TreeItem_method_move_before)

Moves this TreeItem right before the given `item`.

\ **Note:** You can't move to the root or move the root.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_TreeItem_method_propagate_check"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **propagate_check**\ (\ column\: [int](class_int.md), emit_signal\: [bool](class_bool.md) = true\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_TreeItem_method_propagate_check)

Propagates this item's checked status to its children and parents for the given `column`. It is possible to process the items affected by this method call by connecting to [Tree.check_propagated_to_item](class_tree.md#class_Tree_signal_check_propagated_to_item). The order that the items affected will be processed is as follows: the item invoking this method, children of that item, and finally parents of that item. If `emit_signal` is ``false``, then [Tree.check_propagated_to_item](class_tree.md#class_Tree_signal_check_propagated_to_item) will not be emitted.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_TreeItem_method_remove_child"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **remove_child**\ (\ child\: [TreeItem](class_treeitem.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_TreeItem_method_remove_child)

Removes the given child **TreeItem** and all its children from the [Tree](class_tree.md). Note that it doesn't free the item from memory, so it can be reused later (see [add_child()](class_treeitem.md#class_TreeItem_method_add_child)). To completely remove a **TreeItem** use [Object.free()](class_object.md#class_Object_method_free).

\ **Note:** If you want to move a child from one [Tree](class_tree.md) to another, then instead of removing and adding it manually you can use [move_before()](class_treeitem.md#class_TreeItem_method_move_before) or [move_after()](class_treeitem.md#class_TreeItem_method_move_after).

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_TreeItem_method_select"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **select**\ (\ column\: [int](class_int.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_TreeItem_method_select)

Selects the given `column`.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_TreeItem_method_set_auto_translate_mode"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **set_auto_translate_mode**\ (\ column\: [int](class_int.md), mode\: [AutoTranslateMode](class_node.md#enum_Node_AutoTranslateMode)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_TreeItem_method_set_auto_translate_mode)

Sets the given column's auto translate mode to `mode`.

All columns use [Node.AUTO_TRANSLATE_MODE_INHERIT](class_node.md#class_Node_constant_AUTO_TRANSLATE_MODE_INHERIT) by default, which uses the same auto translate mode as the [Tree](class_tree.md) itself.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_TreeItem_method_set_autowrap_mode"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **set_autowrap_mode**\ (\ column\: [int](class_int.md), autowrap_mode\: [AutowrapMode](class_textserver.md#enum_TextServer_AutowrapMode)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_TreeItem_method_set_autowrap_mode)

Sets the autowrap mode in the given `column`. If set to something other than [TextServer.AUTOWRAP_OFF](class_textserver.md#class_TextServer_constant_AUTOWRAP_OFF), the text gets wrapped inside the cell's bounding rectangle.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_TreeItem_method_set_custom_draw"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **set_custom_draw**\ (\ column\: [int](class_int.md), object\: [Object](class_object.md), callback\: [StringName](class_stringname.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_TreeItem_method_set_custom_draw)

**Deprecated:** Use [set_custom_draw_callback()](class_treeitem.md#class_TreeItem_method_set_custom_draw_callback) instead.

Sets the given column's custom draw callback to the `callback` method on `object`.

The method named `callback` should accept two arguments: the **TreeItem** that is drawn and its position and size as a [Rect2](class_rect2.md).

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_TreeItem_method_set_custom_draw_callback"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **set_custom_draw_callback**\ (\ column\: [int](class_int.md), callback\: [Callable](class_callable.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_TreeItem_method_set_custom_draw_callback)

Sets the given column's custom draw callback. Use an empty [Callable](class_callable.md) (``Callable()``) to clear the custom callback. The cell has to be in [CELL_MODE_CUSTOM](class_treeitem.md#class_TreeItem_constant_CELL_MODE_CUSTOM) to use this feature.

The `callback` should accept two arguments: the **TreeItem** that is drawn and its position and size as a [Rect2](class_rect2.md).

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_TreeItem_method_set_custom_font"></a>

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_TreeItem_method_set_edit_multiline"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **set_edit_multiline**\ (\ column\: [int](class_int.md), multiline\: [bool](class_bool.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_TreeItem_method_set_edit_multiline)

If `multiline` is ``true``, the given `column` is multiline editable.

\ **Note:** This option only affects the type of control ([LineEdit](class_lineedit.md) or [TextEdit](class_textedit.md)) that appears when editing the column. You can set multiline values with [set_text()](class_treeitem.md#class_TreeItem_method_set_text) even if the column is not multiline editable.

If `enabled` is ``true``, the given `column` is editable.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_TreeItem_method_set_expand_right"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **set_expand_right**\ (\ column\: [int](class_int.md), enable\: [bool](class_bool.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_TreeItem_method_set_expand_right)

If `enable` is ``true``, the given `column` is expanded to the right.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_TreeItem_method_set_icon"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **set_icon**\ (\ column\: [int](class_int.md), texture\: [Texture2D](class_texture2d.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_TreeItem_method_set_icon)

Sets the given cell's icon [Texture2D](class_texture2d.md). If the cell is in [CELL_MODE_ICON](class_treeitem.md#class_TreeItem_constant_CELL_MODE_ICON) mode, the icon is displayed in the center of the cell. Otherwise, the icon is displayed before the cell's text. [CELL_MODE_RANGE](class_treeitem.md#class_TreeItem_constant_CELL_MODE_RANGE) does not display an icon.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_TreeItem_method_set_icon_max_width"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **set_icon_max_width**\ (\ column\: [int](class_int.md), width\: [int](class_int.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_TreeItem_method_set_icon_max_width)

Sets the maximum allowed width of the icon in the given `column`. This limit is applied on top of the default size of the icon and on top of [Tree.icon_max_width](class_tree.md#class_Tree_theme_constant_icon_max_width). The height is adjusted according to the icon's ratio.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_TreeItem_method_set_icon_modulate"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **set_icon_modulate**\ (\ column\: [int](class_int.md), modulate\: [Color](class_color.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_TreeItem_method_set_icon_modulate)

Modulates the given column's icon with `modulate`.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_TreeItem_method_set_icon_overlay"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **set_icon_overlay**\ (\ column\: [int](class_int.md), texture\: [Texture2D](class_texture2d.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_TreeItem_method_set_icon_overlay)

Sets the given cell's icon overlay [Texture2D](class_texture2d.md). The cell has to be in [CELL_MODE_ICON](class_treeitem.md#class_TreeItem_constant_CELL_MODE_ICON) mode, and icon has to be set. Overlay is drawn on top of icon, in the bottom left corner.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_TreeItem_method_set_icon_region"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **set_icon_region**\ (\ column\: [int](class_int.md), region\: [Rect2](class_rect2.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_TreeItem_method_set_icon_region)

Sets the given column's icon's texture region.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_TreeItem_method_set_indeterminate"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **set_indeterminate**\ (\ column\: [int](class_int.md), indeterminate\: [bool](class_bool.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_TreeItem_method_set_indeterminate)

If `indeterminate` is ``true``, the given `column` is marked indeterminate.

\ **Note:** If set ``true`` from ``false``, then column is cleared of checked status.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_TreeItem_method_set_language"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **set_language**\ (\ column\: [int](class_int.md), language\: [String](class_string.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_TreeItem_method_set_language)

Sets language code of item's text used for line-breaking and text shaping algorithms, if left empty current locale is used instead.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_TreeItem_method_set_metadata"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **set_metadata**\ (\ column\: [int](class_int.md), meta\: [Variant](class_variant.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_TreeItem_method_set_metadata)

Sets the metadata value for the given column, which can be retrieved later using [get_metadata()](class_treeitem.md#class_TreeItem_method_get_metadata). This can be used, for example, to store a reference to the original data.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_TreeItem_method_set_range"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **set_range**\ (\ column\: [int](class_int.md), value\: [float](class_float.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_TreeItem_method_set_range)

Sets the value of a [CELL_MODE_RANGE](class_treeitem.md#class_TreeItem_constant_CELL_MODE_RANGE) column.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_TreeItem_method_set_range_config"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **set_range_config**\ (\ column\: [int](class_int.md), min\: [float](class_float.md), max\: [float](class_float.md), step\: [float](class_float.md), expr\: [bool](class_bool.md) = false\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_TreeItem_method_set_range_config)

Sets the range of accepted values for a column. The column must be in the [CELL_MODE_RANGE](class_treeitem.md#class_TreeItem_constant_CELL_MODE_RANGE) mode.

If `expr` is ``true``, the edit mode slider will use an exponential scale as with [Range.exp_edit](class_range.md#class_Range_property_exp_edit).

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_TreeItem_method_set_selectable"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **set_selectable**\ (\ column\: [int](class_int.md), selectable\: [bool](class_bool.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_TreeItem_method_set_selectable)

If `selectable` is ``true``, the given `column` is selectable.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_TreeItem_method_set_structured_text_bidi_override"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **set_structured_text_bidi_override**\ (\ column\: [int](class_int.md), parser\: [StructuredTextParser](class_textserver.md#enum_TextServer_StructuredTextParser)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_TreeItem_method_set_structured_text_bidi_override)

Set BiDi algorithm override for the structured text. Has effect for cells that display text.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_TreeItem_method_set_structured_text_bidi_override_options"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **set_structured_text_bidi_override_options**\ (\ column\: [int](class_int.md), args\: [Array](class_array.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_TreeItem_method_set_structured_text_bidi_override_options)

Set additional options for BiDi override. Has effect for cells that display text.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_TreeItem_method_set_suffix"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **set_suffix**\ (\ column\: [int](class_int.md), text\: [String](class_string.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_TreeItem_method_set_suffix)

Sets a string to be shown after a column's value (for example, a unit abbreviation).

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_TreeItem_method_set_text"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **set_text**\ (\ column\: [int](class_int.md), text\: [String](class_string.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_TreeItem_method_set_text)

Sets the given column's text value.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_TreeItem_method_set_text_alignment"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **set_text_alignment**\ (\ column\: [int](class_int.md), text_alignment\: [HorizontalAlignment](class_@globalscope.md#enum_@GlobalScope_HorizontalAlignment)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_TreeItem_method_set_text_alignment)

Sets the given column's text alignment to `text_alignment`.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_TreeItem_method_set_text_direction"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **set_text_direction**\ (\ column\: [int](class_int.md), direction\: [TextDirection](class_control.md#enum_Control_TextDirection)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_TreeItem_method_set_text_direction)

Sets item's text base writing direction.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_TreeItem_method_set_text_overrun_behavior"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **set_text_overrun_behavior**\ (\ column\: [int](class_int.md), overrun_behavior\: [OverrunBehavior](class_textserver.md#enum_TextServer_OverrunBehavior)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_TreeItem_method_set_text_overrun_behavior)

Sets the clipping behavior when the text exceeds the item's bounding rectangle in the given `column`.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_TreeItem_method_set_tooltip_text"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

Sets the given column's tooltip text.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_TreeItem_method_uncollapse_tree"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **uncollapse_tree**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_TreeItem_method_uncollapse_tree)

Uncollapses all **TreeItem**\ s necessary to reveal this **TreeItem**, i.e. all ancestor **TreeItem**\ s.
